show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: With themed games, props, and singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don‚Äôt be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell‚Äôs take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (‚ÄúWatch out! The yellow ones don‚Äôt stop!‚Äù) just might be the funniest he‚Äôs ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don‚Äôt be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell‚Äôs take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (‚ÄúWatch out! The yellow ones don‚Äôt stop!‚Äù) just might be the funniest he‚Äôs ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

Don‚Äôt be a cotton-headed ninny-muggins. Add on our exclusive ELF pin set and collector‚Äôs glass, while supplies last, and celebrate the 20th anniversary of this modern classic. For a limited time, you can purchase a set of two enamel pins with art by our own Chris Bilheimer, and a 16 oz. collector‚Äôs glass (perfect for maple syrup), when you buy a ticket for a screening of ELF this holiday season. For shows in November, this offer is only available until 11:59PM on 10/30, and for December shows, you have until 11:59PM on 11/19, or until Santa runs out of supplies. Pick up your ELF pin set and glass at the box office before your showtime, and treat every day like Christmas.

show.title: Batman Returns
show.headline: Christmas in Gotham isn't complete without a bat, a cat, and a penguin

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Michelle Pfeiffer as Catwoman in Batman Returns

portraitHeroImage.altText: Michelle Pfeiffer as Catwoman in Batman Returns

event.title: <show-title>Batman Returns</show-title>
event.headline: ‚ÄúLife‚Äôs a bitch, and now, so am I.‚Äù
event.description:
CATWOMAN! Sorry, didn‚Äôt mean to scream. It‚Äôs just that when I was a 7-year-old kid in 1992, that‚Äôs what I kept shouting after watching Tim Burton‚Äôs BATMAN RETURNS. When Oswald Cobblepott aka The Penguin (Danny DeVito) emerges from hiding beneath the streets of Gotham and begins wreaking a new brand of havoc, it‚Äôs up to Batman (Michael Keaton) to intervene and stop the ambitious criminal‚Äôs rise to power. But the odds are stacked against the caped crusader when The Penguin joins forces with corrupt businessman Max Shreck (Christopher Walken) and the unhinged feline femme fatale Catwoman (Michelle Pfeiffer).

Sure, yes, Batman is cool, and Penguin is scary, but Catwoman was serving pussy and power like no other. Were Selena Kyle and her alter ego Catwoman my queer awakening? I mean, probably. The skin-tight suit, the claws, the whip (knocking heads off mannequins and then jump roping out of a department store is gay rights), the big hair, the pathos! My goodness. I just couldn‚Äôt get enough of her, and when I strutted onto the playground back at school doing my best Catwoman, I realized that perhaps my experience was not universal. How could other kids not revel in the camp and chaos that I found so alluring? Well, because they were straight and boring. While ostensibly this is a Batman film, for me and many queers, it‚Äôs Catwoman‚Äôs world and we‚Äôre just living in it. Burton‚Äôs gothic wonderland reaches new heights in what would be his last foray into Gotham City. Gorgeous, dramatic, and deliciously queer, BATMAN RETURNS is one of the best Christmas movies there ever was, and we hope you‚Äôll join us this holiday season and watch this classic on the big screen.

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone‚Äôs family gatherings are a little stressful, aren‚Äôt they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

We‚Äôre giving it the full Movie Party treatment, with special props like pine tree air fresheners, yellow glow sticks, and ugly neckties to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It‚Äôll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

show.title: Clueless
show.headline: The essential ‚Äò90s teen comedy

event.title: <show-title>Clueless</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Make a cameo at this interactive party
event.description:
Before reinventing Jane Austen became clich√©, Amy Heckerling adapted the classic story of Emma into a hilarious, insanely clever satire of adolescence in Beverly Hills. CLUELESS spawned fashion trends and countless slang terms (AS IF!) and gave Alicia Silverstone a reason to exist beyond Aerosmith videos. Almost 30 years later(!), we are still majorly, totally, butt-crazy in love with this movie.

At this special interactive screening, we'll roll with the homies and say all of our favorite lines together, plus we'll have props to help us pretend that, for one glorious night, we're the Class of '95 at Bronson Alcott High School.

We'll play matchmaker for sweet old teachers, make a cameo at the Val party, and thank an LA city bus driver for taking a chance on an unknown kid. So slip on your Calvin Klein dress ‚Äì or come dressed as any of your favorite characters (the more Dionnes, the better!) ‚Äì and make time in your busy pants-dropping schedule to attend.

show.title: The Goonies
show.headline: Heyy yoouu guys!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Corey Feldman, Sean Astin, Ke Huy Quan, and Jeff Cohen in The Goonies

event.title: <show-title>The Goonies</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Heyy yoouu guuyys! We're watching the Goonies!
event.description:
Let‚Äôs face it, THE GOONIES never gets old (and they never say ‚Äúdie‚Äù). With its endearing cast of quirky kids and a plot filled with swashbuckling adventure, it serves as the ultimate fantasy for anyone who feels stuck in the mundane humdrum of everyday life.

Now it‚Äôs your chance to be a Goonie. Join us for a rollicking movie party and we‚Äôll give you everything you need to join the gang, including a pirate eye patch, a marble bag filled with pirate treasure, a bandana, and a fun-sized Baby Ruth, of course. And don‚Äôt worry, we won‚Äôt make you do the truffle shuffle to get in.

So, to everyone who ever wanted to be a Goonie (or for those of you meeting the Goonies for the very first time), join us as we escape into this daring, heartwarming story of lost treasure and enduring friendship.

portraitHeroImage.altText: The Goonies Movie Party Web SHOW Portrait 960x1280

show.title: The Phantom of the Opera (2004)
show.headline: The classic musical comes to life on the big screen

event.title: <show-title>The Phantom of the Opera (2004)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wear the mask and sing the songs at this interactive epic
event.description:
Take BATMAN & ROBIN director Joel Schumacher, add in Cats scribe Andrew Lloyd Webber, throw in a huge dose of opera (with just a dash of Minnie Driver), and you‚Äôve got yourself some grand campy goodness.

Join us for THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA Movie Party, a musical extravaganza that‚Äôll throw its magical lasso around you and never let go. We‚Äôll have candles to illuminate the chandelier scene, roses to celebrate Christine, bracelets from the Opera Ghost (or the Angel of Music, not sure which), and, of course, your very own Phantom mask. All we ask of you is that you and your friends come ready to belt out some opera (we're sure you'll sound molto bene) as we revel in the music of the night.

show.title: eXistenZ
show.headline: Play it. Live it. Kill for it.

show.title: Deep Blue Sea
show.headline: Bigger. Smarter. Faster. Meaner.

event.title: <show-title>Deep Blue Sea</show-title>
event.headline: Bigger. Smarter. Faster. Meaner.
event.description:
"What you've done is taken God's oldest killing machine and given it will and desire. What you've done is knocked us all the way to the bottom of the goddamn food chain. It's not a great leap forward in my book."

There are shark movies...and then there is DEEP BLUE SEA, which makes JAWS look like FREE WILLY. A crack team of scientists becomes bait (while trying to cure Alzheimer's) for a trio of intelligent, genetically-modified sharks that are BIGGER. SMARTER. FASTER. MEANER. This movie has it all. It's got Thomas Jane doing what he does best...being a badass (this time in a wetsuit!). It's got Saffron Burrows stripping down to her bra and panties to fight a shark for some inexplicable reason (for science?). It's got LL Cool J with a parrot. And it's got Samuel L. Jackson stealing the show with one of the best deaths in movie history. Get these motherf****** sharks off my motherf****** underwater Alzheimer's research facility!

To quote LLCJ, "Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I shall fear no evil. For thou art with me. Thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me. Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life. Because I carry a big stick and I'm the meanest motherf***** in the valley! Two sharks down, Lord! One demon fish to go! Can I get an Amen?" AMEN!

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Blair Witch Project
show.headline: Before CLOVERFIELD, there was...THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT

event.title: <show-title>The Blair Witch Project</show-title>
event.headline: Before CLOVERFIELD, there was...THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT
event.description:
In October 1994, three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, to make a documentary about the mythical Blair Witch. What starts off as a straightforward piece slowly becomes more and more mysterious and terrifying. Soon the filmmakers care more about finding their way out of the woods than making a film... A year later, their footage was found.

For better or worse, THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT has become one of ‚Äì if not the most ‚Äì influential modern horror films. Its simplistic premise and found-footage technique (or gimmick, depending on who you ask) have had countless imposters over the last 15 years, but none of them have come close to achieving the effectiveness that BLAIR WITCH encompasses. Famously shot for $60,000, the film made a staggering, game-changing $250 million worldwide at the box office and became a phenomenon. What seems to have gotten lost over the years is that this is still a first-rate horror film.

show.title: Dial Code Santa Claus
show.headline: Welcome to your new favorite holiday slayride

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Hero Image Dial Code Santa Claus

portraitHeroImage.altText: Hero Image Dial Code Santa Claus

event.title: <show-title>Dial Code Santa Claus</show-title>
event.headline: Your new favorite holiday slayride.
event.description:
Previously only available via VHS bootlegs, DIAL CODE SANTA CLAUS (aka DEADLY GAMES) is your new favorite holiday slayride. Thomas is a typical 1980s kid: he loves computers, role-playing games, and his dog. While Mom is away at the office on Christmas Eve, Thomas and his grandfather are left home alone‚Äîperfect timing for a disgruntled, bloodthirsty mall Santa Claus to climb down the chimney and terrorize the house. But Hell hath no fury like a mulleted ten-year-old with an arsenal of toys! Shot a year before HOME ALONE, the French-made DIAL CODE SANTA CLAUS has almost the same plot‚Äîonly filled with more style, bloodshed, and Rambo references.

Screening a restored 35mm print.

show.title: Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker
show.headline: Susan Tyrell is one bad mama.

event.title: <show-title>Butcher, Baker, Nightmare Maker</show-title>
event.headline: Susan Tyrell is one bad mama.
event.description:
What movie has more "crazy aunt" screen time than SLEEPAWAY CAMP, is more Oedipal than PSYCHO, and quite possibly more awesome than your brain can handle? It‚Äôs NIGHT WARNING, aka BUTCHER, BAKER, NIGHTMARE MAKER! When baby Billy lost his parents in a horrifically magnificent car accident, Aunt Cheryl (Susan Tyrrell) raised him as her own. She‚Äôs grown quite fond of Billy, and now he‚Äôs all grown up, but a girlfriend (Julia Duffy) and a basketball scholarship threaten to take him away from her. Things only get worse when Aunt Cheryl kills a TV repairman in a fit of sexual frustration, and the homophobic detective (Bo Svenson) is intent on putting Billy away for it. So of course she has to make sure that no one comes between her and her Billy. Oh, yeah ‚Äì Bill Paxton shows up at all the right times too. (Neil Wilson)

New Restoration from Severin Films

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it‚Äôs a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Cemetery Man
show.headline: Zombies, guns and sex, oh my!

event.title: <show-title>Cemetery Man</show-title>
event.headline: Demented Italian fantasy/horror, newly restored via Severin Films.
event.description:
Francesco Dellamorte (Rupert Everett) is the groundskeeper at a cemetery where the dead just won't stay dead ‚Äì and it's up to him to deal with those who come back to life with a hunger for human flesh. But Dellamorte's job soon becomes much more complicated when he falls for an enigmatic young woman (Anna Falchi) whose husband has recently died. Based on the novel by Tiziano Sclavi (DYLAN DOG) and directed by Michele Soavi (THE CHURCH), CEMETERY MAN is a late masterpiece of Italian horror: quirky, gory, romantic, and unlike anything else.

Soavi‚Äôs cult classic CEMETERY MAN (DELLAMORTE DELLAMORE), a tribute to the giallo masters with whom he apprenticed, is a vertiginous blend of the high delirium of the Italian genre and a mind-bending meta-product at least 20 years ahead of its time. A zombie film, a sexy romance, a comedy, and at last a tragedy, see this tasteful rarity on the big screen as the gods intended.

New 4K restoration courtesy of Severin Films

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Invasion of the Body Snatchers (1978)
show.headline: Philip Kaufman‚Äôs paranoid panic, newly restored.

event.title: <show-title>Invasion of the Body Snatchers (1978)</show-title>
event.headline: Philip Kaufman‚Äôs paranoid panic, newly restored
event.description:
Part of the Big Three of superior '50s horror remakes (along with John Carpenter's THE THING and David Cronenberg's THE FLY), Philip Kaufman's INVASION OF THE BODY SNATCHERS similarly puts a full-color, visceral spin on Don Siegel's classic tale of an insidious alien takeover. Donald Sutherland stars as a San Francisco health inspector who, along with a colleague played by Brooke Adams, discovers that the populace is being replaced by "pod people" who are identical in every way ‚Äì except for their lack of emotion. A nightmare chase ensues in which our heroes can no longer trust their friends and loved ones, punctuated by moments of sheer shock and terror (which somehow got away with a PG rating back in 1978). The strong supporting cast includes Leonard Nimoy in what may be his best non-Spock role and an early turn by Jeff Goldblum (plus cameos by Siegel and his version's star, Kevin McCarthy), and it all leads up to one of the most chilling conclusions in genre film history. Come see it on the big screen and get taken over all over again!

4k DCP courtesy of Park Circus

show.title: Messiah of Evil
show.headline: An artful nightmare from filmmakers Gloria Katz and Willard Huyck

event.title: <show-title>Messiah of Evil</show-title>
event.headline: Psych-out zombie weirdness from the writers of AMERICAN GRAFFITI.
event.description: After receiving a string of unsettling letters from her father, Arletty arrives in a sleepy California coastal town called Point Dune. Dad is nowhere to be seen. Instead, Arletty finds a town full of drugged-out burnouts, barren shopping centers, and... something else. Echoing everything from Herk Harvey's CARNIVAL OF SOULS to Mario Bava's KILL, BABY... KILL!, MESSIAH OF EVIL is a swirling vortex of Lovecraftian terror, analog synth attacks, and grisly bloodshed from the team who'd later go on to make HOWARD THE DUCK. Marianna Hill (HIGH PLAINS DRIFTER), Michael Greer (FORTUNE AND MEN'S EYES), and Elisha Cook Jr. (THE MALTESE FALCON) star in this unjustly overlooked major work of independent American horror that's primed for (re)discovery. (AGFA)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Silent Night, Deadly Night Part 2
show.headline: The nightmare is about to begin...again!

event.title: <show-title>Silent Night, Deadly Night Part 2</show-title>
event.headline: The nightmare is about to begin...again!
event.description:
Every day is "Garbage Day!" Ricky ‚Äì the traumatized brother of the psychopathic Billy from SILENT NIGHT, DEADLY NIGHT ‚Äì has been released from the mental hospital. But before he can start life anew, Ricky must destroy Mother Superior, the powerful nun who caused his brother's violent demise. Be it by knife, umbrella, or car battery, Ricky unleashes a bloodbath of carnage on unsuspecting victims as he makes his way to Mother Superior's home on Christmas ‚Äì Santa suit in tow. Making clever use of recycled footage from its predecessor and featuring an unhinged performance by star Eric Freeman, SILENT NIGHT, DEADLY NIGHT PART 2 is an unforgettable yuletide horror experience.

DCP courtesy of the American Genre Film Archive

show.title: The Iron Giant
show.headline: It came from outer space

show.title: Dr. Caligari
show.headline: Let‚Äôs all go on a Radiation Vacation together!

event.title: <show-title>Dr. Caligari</show-title>
event.headline: A New Wave gender-bender of cannibals and Cleopatra wigs.
event.description:
Fill a syringe with one part '80s New Wave, one part avant-garde theater, and probably three to five parts wacked-out horniness to concoct DR. CALIGARI, a forerunner for the strangest spiritual sequel ever. Here the granddaughter of German Expressionism's most famous hypnotist runs a sex sanitarium from Pee-wee Herman's nightmares, enforcing her will with an iron grip and needles full of gender hormones. Boys turn to girls, girls turn to boys, and soon enough the entire asylum flips on its head... not to mention the needy housewives and flesh mattresses and DEVO jumpsuits. Featuring one of cinema's most underrated evil women and eye-popping production design, DR. CALIGARI is a hyperstylized madhouse you won't want to leave. (Morgan Hyde)

4k DCP courtesy of Mondo Macabro

show.title: Mute Witness
show.headline: The most underrated wintry thriller of the 1990s

event.title: <show-title>Mute Witness</show-title>
event.headline: The most underrated wintry thriller of the 1990s
event.description:
The first international production shot in Moscow following the fall of the Soviet Union, MUTE WITNESS finds Billy, a non-verbal special effects artist, coming across an after-hours snuff film shoot. Marrying De Palma-esque maximalism with a cat-and-mouse thriller, fact and fiction collide in one of the most undersung genre works of the 1990s. Featuring a barely ambulatory Alec Guinness as a Russian gangster!

Get in on the ground floor of the cult before the end of the year. (Jake Isgar)

DCP courtesy of the American Genre Film Archive via Arrow Video

show.title: To Die For
show.headline: Kidman shines in tabloid trash turned high art

event.title: <show-title>To Die For</show-title>
event.headline: Kidman shines in tabloid trash turned high art
event.description: Gus Van Sant turns tabloid trash to quick-witted high art in this ripped-from-the-headlines tale of a TV reporter (Nicole Kidman) and the two boneheaded teens (baby-faced Casey Affleck and Joaquin Phoenix) she hires to kill her husband. One of the seminal Nicole Kidman performances, TO DIE FOR cemented her status as one of the rising stars of her era and set the stage for a long-spanning career full of fearless transformations.

show.title: Snake in the Eagle's Shadow
show.headline: The kung-fu comedy that made Jackie Chan a star

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Snake in the Eagles alt Still

portraitHeroImage.altText: Snake in the Eagles alt Still

event.title: <show-title>Snake in the Eagle's Shadow</show-title>
event.headline: The kung-fu comedy that made Jackie Chan a star
event.description:
WARPED & FADED: Weird Wednesday and the Birth of the American Genre Film Archive, by Lars Nilsen and Friends and Edited by Kier-la Janisse, is available for pre-order now at The Mondo Shop.

Attempts to make the athletic, charismatic Jackie Chan the next Bruce Lee were falling short of the mark, so producer Ng See-Yuen hired first time director Yuen Woo-Ping (choreographer on The Matrix, Kill Bill, etc) and the team added the key ingredient that was missing: comedy. Chan's acrobatic abilities and comedic timing are put to full use as he suffers through slapstick humiliation on a path to vengeance through various animal styles of kung fu. Incongruous synth tracks bop on the soundtrack as Chan tumbles and leaps his way to stardom. The same creative crew followed this up with DRUNKEN MASTER and the rest is history!

show.title: AMERICAN MOVIE

show.title: Varsity Blues
show.headline: Never show weakness, the only pain that matters is the pain you inflict.

posterImages.altText: MV5 BZG Vl Yj Rm YT Ut NT Ri YS00 OD Nm L Thl ND Qt Nzc3 OW Jm Y Tlk Mz M0 L2lt Y Wdl Xk Ey Xk Fqc Gde QX Vy MT Qx Nz Mz NDI V1 F Mjpg UX1000

event.title: <show-title>Varsity Blues</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: Never show weakness, the only pain that matters is the pain you inflict.
event.description:
VARSITY BLUES is a crazy quilt of dumb-jock jokes, generation-gap drama and sometimes dazzling gridiron action, all of which screenwriter W. Peter Iliff stitches together into a memorable teen flick.

VARSITY also marked an auspicious screen debut for "Dawson's Creek" star James Van Der Beek, who does a thoroughly respectable job -- and manages to pull off a credible Southwestern accent -- as a second-string high school quarterback reluctantly shoved into the spotlight. The movie is set in a Texas hamlet called West Canaan where football is an all-consuming obsession; in one of the script's more novel touches, the adults in town seem even more caught up in the competition than the kids do.

For example, even though he's one of the West Canaan Coyotes, Jonathan "Mox" Moxon (Van Der Beek) would rather read "Slaughterhouse Five" on the sidelines and prepare for an Ivy League education than fully throw himself into the game, a mind-set that baffles coach Bud Kilmer (Jon Voight, frighteningly true-to-life), a dictatorial type who will do literally anything to ensure his team has a chance at the state championship.

In its strongest scenes VARSITY addresses such issues as parents trying to live vicariously through their children and the misguided practice of patching up players with pain-killers and sending them back out on the field instead of to the emergency room. Iliff also puts across the sad but true notion that for some of these kids football (or, for young women, snagging a football player) is one of the few ways to escape spending your life in a dead-end town. The clash between the over-zealous Kilmer and his quietly rebellious new star is equally well-dramatized.

Lest VARSITY sound like a sort of LONELINESS OF THE LONG-DISTANCE RUNNER for the pigskin crowd, Iliff also throws in boozy teen free-for-alls, a subplot involving a dowdy sex-ed teacher who moonlights as a stripper and the now-legendary moment in which Ali Larter shows off her whipped-cream bikini. Oh, and convenience store clerks give Mox free six-packs and the team whoops it up in a topless bar where nobody bats an eye at the sight of a bunch of 17-year-olds downing shots. If you're guessing this movie came from MTV Pictures, you are correct.

But, for millions of teens in 1999, the combination clicked. VARSITY BLUES was a surprise hit, proving plenty of beefcake (and Van Der Beek-cake) for the ladies and generous portions of cheesecake for the guys. Everybody wins!

show.title: Lost Highway
show.headline: A 25th Anniversary 4K Restoration, supervised by David Lynch

event.title: <show-title>Lost Highway</show-title>
event.description: After a five-year hiatus following the release of FIRE WALK WITH ME, Lynch returned with perhaps his most daring and disturbing work since ERASERHEAD. LOST HIGHWAY follows an LA jazz saxophonist‚Äôs (Bill Pullman) withering relationship with his wife (Patricia Arquette), who receive cryptic, menacing surveillance tapes of their Hollywood home. As the anxiety within their marriage grows, the logic of time, space, and identity seem to slip away, splintering the narrative into a thrilling, schizophrenic ride down the darkest roads of the human psyche. It's a beautiful edifice of echoes to house an unwaveringly subjective cinema.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We‚Äôd love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.
